articles.title: Logging In
articles.content:
How to Access MedFlow:

**Staff Portal Login:**
1. Navigate to your MedFlow URL
2. Enter your Email Address
3. Enter your Password
4. Click Sign In

**Patient Portal Login:**
1. Navigate to the Patient Portal URL
2. Enter your registered Email Address
3. Enter your Password
4. Click Sign In

**Social Login (OAuth):**
Click one of the social login buttons:
‚Ä¢ Sign in with Google
‚Ä¢ Sign in with Microsoft
‚Ä¢ Sign in with Facebook

Then authorize MedFlow to access your account.

**Forgot Password:**
1. Click 'Forgot Password' on login screen
2. Enter your email address
3. Check email for reset link (valid 1 hour)
4. Click link and create new password
5. Confirm new password
6. Log in with new credentials

**First-Time Login:**
You may be prompted to:
‚Ä¢ Change your temporary password
‚Ä¢ Set up your user profile
‚Ä¢ Upload profile picture (optional)
‚Ä¢ Set language preference
‚Ä¢ Review assigned roles

**Security Best Practices:**
‚Ä¢ Never share your password
‚Ä¢ Log out when leaving workstation
‚Ä¢ Use unique password for MedFlow
‚Ä¢ Report suspicious activity
‚Ä¢ Keep contact information current

articles.title: Waitlist Management
articles.content:
**NEW IN V1.1:** Waitlist now fully integrated into Practice Management!

**Accessing Waitlist:**
1. Go to Practice Management module
2. Click the 'Waitlist' tab (next to List and Calendar)
3. View all patients with status tracking

**Adding Patient to Waitlist:**

**Method 1 - From Appointment Scheduling:**
1. Attempt to schedule appointment
2. If no slots available, click 'Add to Waitlist'
3. Fill in waitlist details
4. Click Save

**Method 2 - Directly from Waitlist Tab:**
1. Go to Practice Management > Waitlist
2. Click '+ Add to Waitlist' button
3. Complete the form
4. Click Save

**Required Fields:**
‚Ä¢ Patient (search and select)
‚Ä¢ Provider (preferred provider)
‚Ä¢ Appointment Type
‚Ä¢ Priority (High/Medium/Low)

**Optional Fields:**
‚Ä¢ Preferred Date Range
‚Ä¢ Preferred Time (Morning/Afternoon/Any)
‚Ä¢ Reason for visit
‚Ä¢ Internal notes

**Priority Levels:**
üî¥ HIGH - Urgent medical need, time-sensitive follow-up (notified first)
üü° MEDIUM - Standard follow-up, moderately important (notified second)
üü¢ LOW - Routine check-up, flexible timing (notified last)

**Status Tracking:**
‚Ä¢ Active - Waiting for appointment slot
‚Ä¢ Notified - Patient notified of available slot
‚Ä¢ Scheduled - Appointment has been scheduled
‚Ä¢ Cancelled - Patient no longer needs appointment
‚Ä¢ Expired - Patient didn't respond within timeframe

**Auto-Notification System:**
When matching slot becomes available:
1. System identifies matches (provider, type, preferences)
2. Sorts by priority (High > Medium > Low) and date
3. Notifies highest-priority patient via SMS, email, portal
4. Updates status to 'Notified'
5. Patient has 24 hours to confirm

**Confirming Appointments:**
When patient responds 'Yes':
1. Click 'Confirm Appointment' next to entry
2. System automatically creates appointment
3. Updates status to 'Scheduled'
4. Sends confirmation to patient
5. Removes from active waitlist

When patient responds 'No' or doesn't respond:
1. Click 'Move to Next'
2. Original entry marked 'Expired'
3. Next priority patient automatically notified

**Best Practices:**
‚Ä¢ Reserve High priority for medically urgent cases
‚Ä¢ Document patient preferences in notes
‚Ä¢ Review waitlist daily for expired entries
‚Ä¢ Call high-priority patients proactively
‚Ä¢ Clean up entries older than 30 days
‚Ä¢ Verify patient contact information is current

articles.title: Prescriptions & ePrescribe
articles.content:
**NEW IN V1.1:** Edit mode now prefills medication name with step-by-step workflow!

**Accessing ePrescribe:**

**From Patient Chart:**
1. Open patient's chart
2. Go to 'Medications' tab
3. Click '+ New Prescription' button
4. ePrescribe modal opens with 4-step workflow

**From Clinical Encounter:**
1. During patient visit/clinical note
2. Click 'Prescribe Medication' in toolbar
3. Patient context pre-loaded

**4-Step Workflow:**

**STEP 1: Search Medication**
1. Type medication name or NDC code
2. Select specific drug formulation:
   ‚Ä¢ Brand name or generic
   ‚Ä¢ Strength (10mg, 20mg, etc.)
   ‚Ä¢ Form (tablet, capsule, liquid)
3. Review drug information
4. Click 'Next'

**NEW:** In edit mode, medication name is prefilled - skip search!

**STEP 2: Prescription Details**
Enter:
‚Ä¢ Dosage (strength and quantity per dose)
‚Ä¢ Frequency (once daily, twice daily, every 6 hours)
‚Ä¢ Route (oral, topical, IV, IM)
‚Ä¢ Duration (7 days, 30 days, until finished)
‚Ä¢ Quantity (total number to dispense)
‚Ä¢ Refills (0, 1, 2, 3, PRN)
‚Ä¢ Instructions (patient-facing SIG directions)
‚Ä¢ Notes (internal clinical notes)

**Special Options:**
‚Ä¢ Generic Substitution toggle (DAW)
‚Ä¢ Prior Authorization checkbox
‚Ä¢ Controlled Substance auto-flagged

**STEP 3: Select Pharmacy**
1. Patient's preferred pharmacy pre-selected
2. Search by name, address, or zip code
3. Choose from recent pharmacies
4. Add new pharmacy if needed

**STEP 4: Review and Submit**
1. Review all information:
   ‚Ä¢ Patient demographics and allergies
   ‚Ä¢ Medication details and instructions
   ‚Ä¢ Pharmacy information
   ‚Ä¢ Drug interactions and warnings

2. **NEW:** Link to Diagnosis
   ‚Ä¢ Select primary diagnosis for prescription
   ‚Ä¢ Links to ICD-10 code for insurance
   ‚Ä¢ Improves claim approval rates

3. Apply digital signature
4. Click 'Submit Prescription'

**Drug Interaction Checking:**
üî¥ CRITICAL - Severe interaction, prescription blocked (override required)
üü° MODERATE - Potential interaction, warning displayed
üü¢ MINOR - Low-risk interaction, informational
‚ö†Ô∏è ALLERGY - Patient allergic, blocked (override with justification)
üë∂ AGE - Not recommended for age, warning
ü§∞ PREGNANCY - Contraindicated in pregnancy

**Editing Existing Prescriptions:**
1. Go to Patient Chart > Medications
2. Find prescription in active list
3. Click 'Edit' icon
4. **NEW:** Medication name prefilled (can't change drug)
5. Update dosage, frequency, quantity, instructions
6. Navigate between steps with context maintained
7. Click 'Update Prescription'

**Managing Prescriptions:**

**Renewing:**
1. Click 'Renew' next to prescription
2. Review and update if needed
3. Update refill count and quantity
4. Submit renewed prescription

**Discontinuing:**
1. Click 'Discontinue'
2. Select reason (completed, adverse reaction, no longer needed)
3. Add optional notes
4. Confirm discontinuation

**Status Tracking:**
‚Ä¢ Pending - Submitted, not processed by pharmacy
‚Ä¢ Sent - Transmitted to pharmacy
‚Ä¢ Received - Pharmacy acknowledged
‚Ä¢ Filled - Pharmacy filled prescription
‚Ä¢ Picked Up - Patient picked up medication
‚Ä¢ Error - Transmission failed, resubmit
‚Ä¢ Cancelled - Prescription cancelled

**Controlled Substances (EPCS):**
‚Ä¢ Valid DEA number required
‚Ä¢ Two-factor authentication for each CS prescription
‚Ä¢ State-specific rules apply
‚Ä¢ No refills for Schedule II

**Best Practices:**
‚Ä¢ Always review allergies before prescribing
‚Ä¢ Link prescriptions to diagnoses
‚Ä¢ Write clear, patient-friendly instructions
‚Ä¢ Never ignore drug interaction warnings
‚Ä¢ Verify pharmacy selection
‚Ä¢ Document alert overrides
‚Ä¢ Keep medication list current
‚Ä¢ Check prescription status

articles.title: Laboratory Orders
articles.content:
**NEW IN V1.1:** CPT multiselect (80+ tests), recurring orders, and enhanced print functionality!

**Accessing Lab Orders:**

**From Patient Chart:**
1. Open patient's chart
2. Go to 'Laboratory' tab
3. Click '+ New Lab Order' button

**From Clinical Encounter:**
1. During patient visit/note documentation
2. Click 'Order Labs' in encounter toolbar
3. Patient context auto-populated

**Creating Lab Order - 6 Steps:**

**STEP 1: Basic Information**
‚Ä¢ Patient (pre-populated from context)
‚Ä¢ Ordering Provider (usually current user)
‚Ä¢ Order Date (defaults to today)
‚Ä¢ Priority (Routine, STAT, ASAP)
‚Ä¢ Clinical Indication (ICD-10 diagnosis - REQUIRED)

**STEP 2: Select Lab Tests (CPT Codes)**
**NEW:** Multi-select interface for multiple tests!

1. Click 'Select Tests' field
2. Dropdown shows 80+ common tests organized by category:

**Categories:**
ü©∏ Hematology - CBC (85025), CBC with Diff (85027), Platelet Count
üß¨ Chemistry - BMP (80048), CMP (80053), Glucose (82947)
üíâ Coagulation - PT/INR (85610), PTT (85730), D-Dimer
üß™ Lipids - Lipid Panel (80061), Cholesterol, Triglycerides
üî¨ Microbiology - Urinalysis (81001), Urine Culture (87086)
üíä Therapeutic - Drug levels (Digoxin, Theophylline)
ü©∫ Endocrine - TSH (84443), T4 (84439), A1C (83036)
üß´ Immunology - ANA (86038), RF (86431), CRP (86140)

3. Type to search by test name or CPT code
4. Click to select - tests appear as chips/tags
5. Click X on chip to remove test
6. Selected tests show with CPT codes

**Quick Panels:** Select panel to get multiple tests at once
‚Ä¢ Basic Metabolic Panel = 8 individual tests
‚Ä¢ Comprehensive Metabolic Panel = 14 tests
‚Ä¢ Lipid Panel = 4 tests

**STEP 3: Collection Details**
‚Ä¢ Collection Method (In-Clinic, At Laboratory, Home Collection)
‚Ä¢ **NEW:** Scheduled Date/Time (supports future dates!)
‚Ä¢ Fasting Required (toggle Yes/No)
‚Ä¢ Fasting Duration (8, 10, or 12 hours)
‚Ä¢ Specimen Type (Blood, Urine, Stool, Throat Swab, etc.)

**NEW: Recurring Orders**
For chronic condition monitoring:
1. Toggle 'Recurring Order' switch
2. Select frequency:
   ‚Ä¢ Daily
   ‚Ä¢ Weekly (specify day)
   ‚Ä¢ Bi-weekly
   ‚Ä¢ Monthly (specify day of month)
   ‚Ä¢ Quarterly
   ‚Ä¢ Custom interval
3. Set start date and end date (or # of occurrences)
4. System auto-generates future orders

**Use Cases for Recurring:**
‚Ä¢ Monthly INR for warfarin patients
‚Ä¢ Quarterly A1C for diabetic patients
‚Ä¢ Weekly drug levels for specific medications

**STEP 4: Laboratory Selection**
1. Preferred Lab (patient's preferred if on file)
2. Search by name, location, specialty
3. In-Network Labs (filter by patient insurance)
4. Verify lab performs ordered tests

**STEP 5: Results Distribution**
**NEW:** Multi-select recipients!
Select who receives results:
‚Ä¢ Ordering Provider (auto-selected)
‚Ä¢ Primary Care Physician
‚Ä¢ Specialist (from care team)
‚Ä¢ Patient Portal (auto-posts when ready)
‚Ä¢ Other Provider (search and add)

**STEP 6: Review and Submit**
1. Review all order details
2. Verify tests and CPT codes
3. Confirm laboratory and collection method
4. Check result recipients
5. Click 'Submit Order'

**After Submission:**
‚Ä¢ Order transmitted electronically to lab
‚Ä¢ Requisition form generated
‚Ä¢ Patient receives instructions (portal/email/SMS)
‚Ä¢ Order appears in pending labs list

**Enhanced Print Functionality:**

**Print Options:**
1. After creating order, click 'Print'
2. Choose format:
   ‚Ä¢ Full Requisition - Complete form with all details
   ‚Ä¢ Patient Instructions - Prep instructions only
   ‚Ä¢ Both - Requisition + instructions on separate pages
3. Preview before printing
4. Print directly or save as PDF

**Requisition Includes:**
‚Ä¢ Patient demographics and insurance
‚Ä¢ All ordered tests with CPT codes
‚Ä¢ ICD-10 diagnosis codes
‚Ä¢ Provider information and signature
‚Ä¢ Collection instructions
‚Ä¢ Laboratory barcode

**Managing Lab Orders:**

**Status Tracking:**
‚Ä¢ Pending - Order created, awaiting collection
‚Ä¢ Scheduled - Collection appointment scheduled
‚Ä¢ Collected - Specimen collected, sent to lab
‚Ä¢ In Progress - Lab processing tests
‚Ä¢ Partial Results - Some results available
‚Ä¢ Completed - All results received
‚Ä¢ Cancelled - Order cancelled before collection

**Cancelling Orders:**
1. Go to Patient Chart > Laboratory
2. Find pending order
3. Click 'Cancel Order'
4. Select reason and add notes
5. Confirm cancellation
Note: Can only cancel before specimen collection

**Viewing Results:**
1. System notification for new results
2. Go to Patient Chart > Laboratory
3. Click completed order
4. Review results panel:
   ‚Ä¢ Test name and value
   ‚Ä¢ Reference range
   ‚Ä¢ Abnormal flag (H, L, Critical)
   ‚Ä¢ Result date/time
   ‚Ä¢ Performing lab

**Abnormal Results:**
üî¥ Critical (H/L) - Red text, immediate attention
üü° Abnormal - Yellow background, outside range
‚ö™ Normal - Standard display, within range

**Critical Values:** Trigger immediate alerts via SMS, email, system notification. Must acknowledge and document follow-up.

**Documenting Review:**
1. Click 'Sign Results'
2. Add interpretation notes
3. Document follow-up plan:
   ‚Ä¢ No action needed
   ‚Ä¢ Retest scheduled
   ‚Ä¢ Treatment adjustment
   ‚Ä¢ Specialist referral
   ‚Ä¢ Patient notified
4. Apply electronic signature

**Best Practices:**
‚Ä¢ Always include diagnosis for insurance approval
‚Ä¢ Use panels when appropriate to reduce costs
‚Ä¢ Check for duplicates before ordering
‚Ä¢ Set correct priority (reserve STAT for emergencies)
‚Ä¢ Verify fasting requirements
‚Ä¢ Use recurring orders for chronic monitoring
‚Ä¢ Sign all results promptly
‚Ä¢ Document action on abnormal results
‚Ä¢ Notify patients of results timely
